intro: Thalictrum minus proles flexuosum, commonly known as the slender meadow rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like compound leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in meadows and moist soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and garden cultivation.
